definition: to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: In fact, there was no revisionism in China.
sentences.chinese: 實際上中國並沒有修正主義上臺。

sentences.english: Revisionism is one form of bourgeois ideology.
sentences.chinese: 修正主義是一種資產階級思想。

sentences.english: They will also give rise to the result of historical revisionism .
sentences.chinese: 這些因素共同作用也會形成歷史修正主義的結果。

sentences.english: Thisis what I read in my revisionist history book. Kinzo wantanabe.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我從修正主義的歷史書中所讀到的內容。

sentences.english: The reputation of the navigator is under assault from historical revisionists.
sentences.chinese: 這位航海家的名譽受到了歷史修正主義者的攻擊。

sentences.english: The Western re-invented itself in the revisionist Western.
sentences.chinese: 在修正主義西部片中，西部電影完成了自我改造。

sentences.english: Both dogmatism and revisionism run counter to Marxism.
sentences.chinese: 於是，特權階層將轉變爲修正主義集團。

sentences.english: We gave up on one or two who were too far gone , they were died - in - the - wool revisionists.
sentences.chinese: 我們放棄了一兩個走得太遠的陷入修正主義的人。
我們是天生的修正主義者。

sentences.english: Lenin was already a "revisionist" by the early 1900s.
sentences.chinese: 列寧在1900年代早期已經是一個“修正主義”了。

definition: to pretend that everything is going well
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
